(OOC: I'm sorry your grandmother didn't make it Carnage)

Tavatron snarled softly, her optics still closed. It was as if by 
shutting them she could shut out the world, or so she hoped. She 
wasn't afraid of the Alliance, or what they were capable of. They
were cowards. Tavatron sighed softly, the sound of her spark humming 
in her ears. The sound of her own spark had always relaxed her, now 
more than ever. Tavarton turned her head so she could face Darkone, a 
pure rage filling her when she laid eyes on one of her captors. She 
spoke in a tone filled with a degree of rage and hate, but she
refused to scream, not even in anger. She didn't want to appear 
desperate in the face of the enemy:

"You are pathetic. The Alliance, all of you, are a joke."

Tavatron chuckled softly as she resumed her blank stare at the bare 
ceiling:

"I am not afraid of you."
